poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
She gears up.
You grease the limbs.
Dull gleams
And buckled greaves on lunar coin
Some miss but no one grieves.
Folk eat their greens and mind their own
Poultry gleans what it can.
The glebes and kirks are quiet.
Grebes on the lochan. Geans
Squander blossom,
Glieds of inspiration
Spent.
